business.headline: Markets in green amid Trump's tariff rowStock market benchmark indices surged on Tuesday as trading resumed following a long weekend, with auto sector stocks leading the gains.

Is Quess Corp share price down over 50%? Not quite, here's what happenedWhat investors are seeing now is the adjusted market value of Quess Corp after the spin-off. The value of the new entities will be discovered once they are listed on the stock exchanges in the coming weeks.

Tata Motors, M&M, Maruti: Why are auto stocks gaining today?Tata Motors led the pack with a gain of over 5%, while Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) climbed nearly 4%. Maruti Suzuki advanced close to 2%, and other prominent names such as Eicher Motors, Bajaj Auto, and Ashok Leyland rose over 1.5%.

Sensex, Nifty rally 2% in early trade. 5 things investors need to knowSensex, Nifty today: Tata Motors led the gains on the Sensex, jumping 5.03% in early trade. Other auto stocks such as Mahindra & Mahindra also performed well, rising 3.74%.
Sensex soars 1,600 points as Trump hints at auto tariff pauseThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,580.01 points to 76,737.27, while the NSE Nifty50 467.30 points to 23,295.85 as of 9:22 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Will stock market gain amid positive global cues?Stock market today: Trading on Dalal Street remained shut on Monday due to Ambedkar Jayanti. As trading resumes, investors are hopeful that the markets will continue their positive trend from Friday, when both Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 2%.

Stocks to watch on April 15: Swiggy, HCLTech, Dr Reddy, Tata Power, IREDAKey stocks to watch on April 15 are shares of Swiggy, HCLTech, Dr Reddy, Tata Power, IREDA ICICI Lombard, ICICI Pru Life, among others, due to varied news developments and Q4 results.

Dr Reddy's asks several top-paid executives to quit in cost-cutting drive: ReportDr Reddy's Laboratories (DRL) FY24 annual report shows it had over 26,000 employees worldwide as of March 2024. That includes 21,757 permanent staff. In FY24, the company hired 6,281 people and spent Rs 5,030 crore on employee benefits,

Over 40? You might be first in line for layoff, says Bombay Shaving Company CEOShantanu Deshpande, founder and CEO of Bombay Shaving Company, said that professionals in their 40s are now the number one targets for layoffs.

Tycoons in turmoil: Indian billionaires caught in Trump's tariff stormThe net worth of Mukesh Ambani, Gautam Adani, Shiv Nadar, and others has taken a massive hit amid a sharp correction in equity markets, fuelled by foreign investor exits and escalating global trade friction. All thanks to US President Donald Trump's tariff shock.

Rs 2.25 crore lumpsum or Rs 84k monthly? Which pension plan should you opt forUnder UPS, the government puts in 10% of your basic salary and dearness allowance and adds another 8.5% to your pension pot. On the other hand, under NPS, the government contributes 14% of your salary.

BluSmart likely to end cab service, join hands with Uber: ReportThe company, which started out by operating electric vehicles on Uber's platform nearly six years ago, is now preparing to shut down its own cab service and supply cars to Uber again.

Investing or borrowing? Check new SBI, HDFC, BOI interest ratesThe latest rate cut signals a broader trend—savers are using savings accounts mainly for transactions, while putting the rest in fixed deposits for better returns.

Mehul Choksi arrested in Belgium: What is the Rs 14,000-crore PNB scam?Mehul Choksi once headed the Gitanjali Group, a well-known jewellery firm. Born in 1959, Choksi was active in the diamond industry for many years.

Bank of India cuts home loan rates for new, existing customers. Check detailsThis adjustment is expected to make borrowing slightly easier for individuals at a time when the RBI is clearly looking to revive private investment and sustain domestic demand.

What to expect from stock market this week? 4 key things investors should knowMultiple factors could determine the mood on Dalal Street. From April 12 to 19, investors will be watching crucial Q4 earnings, economic data releases in India, the US, and China.
Investor visits Mumbai slum, uncovers truth about 'Make in India'Veteran investor Shankar Sharma recently shared a personal experience that raised fresh questions about India's manufacturing reality.

'Shift to UAE': Kotak AMC MD Nilesh Shah flags tax loophole exploited by NRIsNilesh Shah has warned that high-net-worth individuals could exploit tax treaties with some countries to avoid India's capital gains tax.

RBI may pay record Rs 2.5 lakh crore dividend to centre in FY25The RBI is likely to announce the exact dividend amount in late May. Last year, the payout surprised many as it was double what most had expected.

Ambedkar Jayanti 2025: Is the stock market closed today?Over the past few months, benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty have seen large ups and downs, with global news, especially from the United States, playing a major role in the market's movement.

Tariff war may benefit India despite short-term shocks: Mercedes-Benz India CEOMercedes-Benz India CEO Santosh Iyer stated that India may benefit from the ongoing global tariff war in the long term despite short-term challenges. He highlights the potential for increased trade and reduced barriers as a positive outcome for India.

Why is Apple in a race against time to fly iPhones back to the US?Apple's long-term goal is to reduce its dependence on Chinese factories and shift more production to other countries, with India playing a big part in that plan.  However, it relies heavily on a network of suppliers and trained workers that only exists at the required scale in parts of Asia.

RBI launches WhatsApp Channel: Here's how to access it via QR codeThe RBI said that the goal of the WhatsApp channel is to provide verified and timely information about banking, digital safety, and other important topics directly to users.

Pentagon cuts $5.1 billion contracts with Accenture, Deloitte: Wasteful spendingThe contracts appeared to be wide-ranging cuts to consulting services for the Navy, the Air Force, the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) and the Defense Health Agency.

Wall Street bounces back after wild week fueled by tariff warAll three major US indexes ended the session sharply higher after assurances from Boston Federal Reserve President Susan Collins that the Fed is prepared to keep financial markets functioning should the need arise.

India pushing for trade deals with US, EU with high urgency: JaishankarOn Wednesday, Trump announced a 90-day pause on his sweeping tariffs on all countries, except China as countries around the world wilted under the impact of the seismic action.

How Trump tariffs could make iPhones, cars, and clothes costlier in the USTrump's latest plan includes a massive 145% tax on goods coming from China. Experts say this could end the long run of cheap, imported goods that Americans have enjoyed for decades.
Sensex ends 1,300 points higher, Nifty above 22,500; Tata Steel up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,310.11 points to close at 75,157.26, while the NSE Nifty50 added 429.40 points to end at 22,828.55.

Mutual fund SIP vs PPF: What Rs 1 lakh a year can earn in 15 yearsPPF is a government scheme with a current interest rate of around 7.1% per annum. On the other hand, SIPs typically offer higher interest when invested over the long term, especially in equity mutual funds. But they carry some risk, as returns depend on the market.

Explained: Why Muthoot Finance shares fell over 8% todayMuthoot Finance stock price: Muthoot Finance, one of India's largest gold loan companies, has seen its share price decline by 14% in the past five trading sessions. The stock is also down 7% over the past month.

Mutual fund inflows hit in March. Trump tariffs to blame?The largest outflows were seen in debt mutual funds, where investors pulled out Rs 2.02 lakh crore, possibly due to end-of-year financial needs by institutions and ongoing global uncertainty.

Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath's money advice: 'No shortcuts to getting rich'Nithin Kamath shared a video with a powerful message—earning more doesn't mean you're saving more. In fact, higher income often leads to more spending on gadgets, clothes, dining out, or things meant just to impress others.

Trump tariffs, trade war fears could bring your loan EMIs down further this yearBorrowers could emerge as the unexpected winners if global headwinds linger and domestic growth slows further, with the RBI likely to step in again to lower the key interest rates.

Wall Street crashes, Dalal Street rallies: 5 things investors should knowStock market today: Dalal Street's leading indices rallied sharply, defying a global sell-off sparked by Wall Street's overnight crash. Here are the key factors behind today's stock market rally.

Mutual fund inflows fall for March by Rs 4,221 crore, shows AMFI dataEquity mutual fund inflows dropped by Rs 4,221 crore in March, falling to Rs 25,082 crore from Rs 29,303 crore in February 2025, as per data released by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

TCS shares fall after disappointing Q4. Check latest price targetsTCS share price: Despite a muted Q4, brokerages back TCS with revised targets, betting on deal wins, margin levers, and recovery prospects to drive medium-term gains.

Sensex jumps 1,400 points: 3 things to know about Dalal Street rallyShare market today: A surprise rally may have lit up the screens, but with volatility still lurking and trade risks unresolved, investors would do well to tread carefully through this temporary pocket of optimism.

Sensex up by 1,300 points, Nifty above 22,500 as markets cheer tariff pauseStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex surged 1,353.59 points to 75,200.74, while the NSE Nifty 50 gained 443.70 points to 22,842.85 as of 9:43 am.

Stock market today: Will Sensex, Nifty open higher on 90-day pause on tariffs?Sensex, Nifty today: Early signs suggest a positive start. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 22,933.5 at 8:20 am, showing a 2.5% jump from Nifty 50's Wednesday close of 22,399.15.

TCS to delay salary hike? Check what top management said after Q4 resultsTCS reported a net profit of Rs 12,224 crore for the fourth quarter of FY25. This is a 1.7% drop compared to Rs 12,434 crore reported in the same quarter last year.

entertainment.headline: Johnny Depp is most handsome 'Day Drinker' in gritty 1st look from Marc Webb's filmJohnny Depp is gearing up to make his much-awaited Hollywood feature comeback with Marc Webb's Day Drinker. He will reunite with Penélope Cruz in the upcoming thriller.

Broken leg, table and wheelchair in comedian Vir Das's Air India horror storyComedian and actor Vir Das narrated his experience with Air India in a long social media post. The Emmy-winning artiste explained how his flight with his wife turned into a nightmare due to the airline's complacency.

That's all AI could do: Radhikka Madan claps back at trolls over surgery rumoursRadhikka Madan responded to circulating rumours about her undergoing plastic surgery, which were sparked by a viral AI-generated video. The actor dismisses the claims with humour, urging people to continue their speculation.

TMKOC producer Asit Modi finally finds new Dayaben. It's not Disha VakaniAsit Modi, producer of 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has a new update to share about having new Dayaben on board five years after Disha Vakani left the show.

Sharmila Tagore joins Naadaaniyan criticism: Ibrahim looked good, film didn'tVeteran actor Sharmila Tagore shared her thoughts on her grandson Ibrahim Ali Khan's debut film 'Nadaaniyan'. While she praised his appearance, she felt the film didn't meet expectations.

Good Bad Ugly box office Day 5: Ajith's film on historic run domestically, worldwide Ajith's 'Good Bad Ugly' is creating records for both the actor and the Tamil film industry. The film's Monday business was strong, and it has already become the highest-grossing Tamil film of the year.

Jaat box office Day 5: Sunny Deol's film shows solid hold on 1st MondayAfter recording fabulous business on its first Sunday, Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' didn't disappoint with its Monday collection either. The film is expected to wrap up its first week on an impressive note now.

Never back down: Ranveer Allahbadia uplifts himself in inspiring Instagram postRanveer Allahbadia, also known as The Beer Biceps, shared a heartfelt message on Instagram, emphasising resilience and growth. This follows his recent controversy on India's Got Latent, which led to significant backlash and legal challenges.

Diddy pleads not guilty to expanded indictment: 'These are not new allegations'Sean "Diddy" Combs pleaded not guilty to expanded federal sex trafficking charges. Accused of exploiting women from 2004–2024, Combs denies all allegations. His trial begins in May amid mounting legal scrutiny.

Historic Blue Origin flight: Oprah Winfrey cheers on Gayle King's space journeyOprah Winfrey was emotional as Gayle King overcame her fear of flying to join Blue Origin's historic all-women spaceflight. The moment marked friendship, courage, and a step forward for women in space.

Harry Potter TV series: Who's been cast so far and what we knowHBO confirms casting for its Harry Potter series, including Nick Frost as Hagrid and Paapa Essiedu as Snape. The show begins filming in summer 2025 and premieres in 2026.

White Lotus star Aimee Lou Wood criticises SNL sketch as 'mean, unfunny'The White Lotus actor Aimee Lou Wood has voiced her disapproval of a recent SNL sketch that exaggerated her appearance with prosthetic teeth. The actor termed the parody 'mean and unfunny', suggesting it carried misogynistic undertones.
Salman Khan shares gym pics amid new death threat: Thank you for the motivationBollywood star Salman Khan shared new workout photos. This comes hours after he received a new death threat.

Alia Bhatt shares pic with her 'home' Ranbir Kapoor on their 3rd anniversaryAlia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor marked their third wedding anniversary with a heartfelt social media post. The couple, who first met on the sets of Brahmastra, share a glimpse of their journey together.

Fawad Khan, Vaani Kapoor reignite romance in Abir Gulaal's Khudaya Ishq songThe first song from the anticipated film 'Abir Gulaal', 'Khudaya Ishq', has captivated fans with its romance and chemistry between Fawad Khan and Vaani Kapoor. Sung by Arijit Singh and Shilpa Rao, the song highlights the themes of longing and unexpected love.

Katy Perry on why she sang What a Wonderful World in space: It's not about meKaty Perry joined an all-female crew on a Blue Origin space mission, where she sang 'What a Wonderful World'. The mission marked a historic moment with a focus on collective appreciation and future opportunities for women.

Akshay Kumar thanks PM for honouring Sankaran Nair: Kesari Chapter 2 is a reminderAkshay Kumar has reacted to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's praise for Sir C Sankaran Nair and his bold stand against British rule following the Jallianwala Bagh massacre. He thanked the PM for remembering Nair and acknowledging his contribution to India's freedom struggle.

Tu Mera Lover: Ravi Teja, Sreeleela dazzle together in Mass Jathara's first singleRavi Teja and Sreeleela dazzle in 'Tu Mera Lover', a high-energy track from 'Mass Jathara' that blends nostalgia, AI vocals, and mass appeal setting the stage for a box office storm.

Ajith's fans break into fight during Good Bad Ugly screening in KeralaAt a screening of Ajith-starrer 'Good Bad Ugly' in Kerala, the movie theatre became an ugly battleground. A brawl broke out between Vijay and Ajith Kumar's fans.

Kilmar Abrego Garcia: The US wants him back, but El Salvador refuses to returnEl Salvador's President Nayib Bukele refuses to return Kilmar Abrego Garcia, wrongly deported by the US, saying he lacks authority. A federal judge previously ruled that the government must return Abrego Garcia. But the Trump administration pushed back, stating that the judge might not have authority to enforce that.

Don't fall into trap: Mamata Banerjee's peace appeal amid violence in BengalAmid ongoing violence in Murshidabad over the Waqf Act, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee urged people to maintain peace and avoid using religion to incite violence.

Not just the planet: The climate crisis is also affecting our mindsWhile not officially classified as a mental illness, eco-anxiety manifests through symptoms such as helplessness, guilt, and distress. This form of anxiety is particularly prevalent among younger generations who are deeply concerned about the world they will inherit.

Israel-Hamas ceasefire talks collapse again as both sides hold firm on demandsAnother bid to end the Gaza war faltered as Cairo talks collapsed with no truce or hostage deal. Hamas demanded a full end to the war, while Israel sought the terror group's disarmament.

PM meets Rampal Kashyap, his barefoot admirer in Haryana, helps him put on shoesPM Modi met Rampal Kashyap, who had pledged to walk barefoot until he became PM and met him. Modi gifted him shoes and urged everybody to channel their devotion into nation-building.

Tamil Nadu villagers protest after receiving notice declaring land as Waqf propertyVillagers in Tamil Nadu's Vellore district were shocked after a notice declared their agricultural land as Waqf property, prompting fears of displacement and calls for urgent government intervention.

LSG vs CSK Highlights: Dhoni, Dube power Chennai to 5-wicket winIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK Highlights: Chennai Super Kings snapped their five-match losing streak after beating the Lucknow Super Giants by five wickets on Monday at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
